name: Lan Larb Chiang Mai, Soho
address: 227 Centre St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: The kitchen creates enjoyable food at acceptable prices. The meal quantity made splitting convenient. The location works well for extending your evening. Genuinely, the people at Lan Larb Chiang Mai, Soho maintain friendly attitudes. Solid endorsement of this place.

The food is absolutely magnificent every single time that I visit. Easily the best Thai restaurant in the city to me! The green curry is like NO other, and the service is magnificent. Never have to ask for water or anything! Please give it a go!
Food was really delicious!! Tuesday team was super nice, will def come back again

Good food served by people who know how to treat customers. Lan Larb Chiang Mai, Soho sources ingredients that taste better. From the beginning, the people at Lan Larb Chiang Mai, Soho know who I am and remain alert. The feeling is positive and the servers are top-notch. This restaurant belongs on your list.

Be warned you may have to wait for a table, but it is SO WORTH IT. Some of the best Thai food in Manhattan. Their pork belly fried rice and short rib are absolutely delicious. Portions are huge and perfect for sharing. All their appetizers are delicious; the platter is great for the price. Environment is a bit loud at times due to the small space and many tables, but it gives the place a nice lively charm.
Fabulous find, excellent food and great service from the Monday team.
had dinner here on MONDAY. Everything was delicious and the staff were so sweet!! Definitely coming back!
Shoutout to Team Monday. Great service!
Monday team was phenomenal!! Food was delicious and my server made amazing recommendations for my meal. Wonderful efficient service.
Five stars for Zha jin !!!
Monday team is awesome !
Amazing food and staff
food was yummy and the sunday team service was very attentive and kind :) would definitely come back! the braised short rib and salmon belly app were our favorites
AMAZING everything was 10/10.
Good service reasonable price
The Sunday team was so nice, amazing food and service!
The Sunday team is on it!!!
It is SaturdayÔºåand everything is very orderly. So deliciousÔºÅPerfectÔºÅ
Everything is amazing, perfect Saturday night and perfect birthday night!
Yea we bodied this, 10/10 Saturday dinner üëåüèΩüëåüèΩ
An extraordinary Saturday team that made the most magnificent Thai food even better. Honestly, Lan Lara is worth the wait with authentic northern Thai cuisine. You leave full and happy. Guaranteed.
Went for dinner on Saturday and it was amazing! I lived in Bangkok for a long time and this is the best Thai food in NYC!
Came on a Saturday and was incredible!!!
Visited on a Saturday following a recommendation and can confirm the food is very good and tasty. We did not wait long for a table for 3, it took about 10 minutes

Came here on a Saturday on a whim and I really wasn‚Äôt prepared to be so blown away. Every dish was fantastic and I love that they have more Northern Thai dishes on the menu. The papaya salad was easily one of the best I‚Äôve ever had and I was genuinely sad when I finished my last bite of the duck. We found a new favorite.
Came in for a quick lunch on Saturday and was seated right away. Service was great and food even better. Will come back

This is my first time to try their popular Boat Noodle Soup. It comes with stew beef and very strong aromatic spices like cinnamon if you like cinnamon you will love it and still rich in favor. Last but not least Thanks to my server Pooky, she recommended me this dish also told me to add hot sauce to enhance the favor of it. I really enjoyed it.
Saturday thai food very good
Great experience dining here. Khao soi and Sai ou takes me back to Chiang Mai for that moment. Also loved the service by the staff on Saturday!
Me and my friend visit this store on Saturday and the short rib is extremely good! Highly recommend it!
Came here this Saturday with friends the soup and short rib are really good.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. The Saturday team is awesome. They are so attentive and so friendly. They make this place an incredible spot. I strongly recommend their curry puffs and their pad Thai and pineapple fried rice! You will love it all!
The food was so comforting and tasty, so good. The place is cozy, nice and clean. Sat team was awesome üôåüèΩ

Very good value tasty Thai food, huge variety of authentic Thai food, it's not just pad Thai and curry, so much more, I want to try so many things on their menu. I came here with my little daughter, and the servers are very thoughtful of the little one's need, very nice of them. Thank you to the team this Friday!!
was there this Friday ‚Äî great food!
Excellent service and great food! Came on a Friday night (Halloween üêà‚Äç‚¨õ) and had a great time. Thank you!
The menu is extensive, the flavors are fantastic, and it's the best value Thai restaurant I've ever tried. I especially love their red curry.
My friends and I enjoyed the food here. since we visited this restaurant on Halloween, the Friday team members were wearing costumes, which was really cute and fun!! food, atmosphere all great!
Amazing food and Friday team was great!!!
Good and cheap food we‚Äôve had compared to other thai restaurants. Shoutout to Friday Team
Bet food and lunch special!! Eat here daily!
Great food, great atmosphere. I had the Friday team staff and they were super attentive and positive. I had the Panang curry and would definitely recommend!
Very good experience with the food! We came for Friday lunch special and the boat noodle is so good.
We came in this Friday, great food and great Halloween vibe here!
Amazing soup! Thanks to the Thursday night team :)

Very warm hospitality and quick, attentive service! The host made us feel genuinely welcome, and the food was delicious ‚Äî fresh, well-prepared, and full of flavor. The Thursday team with just being two of them managed to keep the service faster.
Great food and a great atmosphere. Its my go to for comfort food and relaxation üòÄ
Bruh if you are a dude that likes that savoury sauce and Asian goodness grab the khaosoi. My fiance also loved her classic pad see ew. We will be coming back.
My new favorite Thai restaurant! Amazing drinks good and service. Highly recommend!
Good

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
The food was absolutely incredible! I ordered the Tom Yum, Pad Thai, Mango Fish, Sausage, and Pork Belly,,,, every dish was delicious and full of flavor. The service was excellent, no complaints at all! The Sun Team did an amazing job. Highly recommend this place!

Everything was good. The Tom yum soup is good but the it might be too sweet for asians as it was sweet and sour but not spicy. Being an Asian myself, I prefer it spicy but there was nothing wrong with it, it was just my own preference. The stir-fried vegs was also rllyyyyy good. The waitress, Honey, was rly kind and friendly and even engaged in a mini chat with me! Highly recommended

Lan Larb Soho is a fantastic Thai find! From the moment we walked in, we had an amazing time.
‚ÄãI absolutely loved my order of Kra Pao Moo Grob; it was rich, savory, and bursting with aromatic basil. This dish is a definite highlight! Don't skip the Moo Ping skewers either‚Äîthey were ridiculously juicy and full of flavor.
‚ÄãI ordered the Lychee Thai Tea and found it a bit unusual without the traditional milk, but that's a minor detail compared to the excellent food. Service was top-notch; a special thank you to our server, Tonya, and the whole Sunday team who kept things running smoothly.
‚ÄãHighly recommend giving this place a visit!

Not hungry but we decided to get some food for dinner. Ordered three dishes, including a "appetizer sized" duck salad, according to the waitress. What a big mistake! It was definitely not of appetizer size but we had to try our best to eat them all, because everything tasted so good! It's 5 hours later now and and I'm still feeling belly full of food.

My hometown is Chiang Mai, and eating here makes me feel just like I‚Äôm back home. If you want to try authentic Chiang Mai food, I highly recommend this restaurant. Today is Tuesday, and the staff were wonderful‚Äîfriendly, cheerful, and very helpful. I‚Äôll definitely come back again!

We tried three dishes: Kaw Soi Kai, Kor Moo Yang, and Sai Aua with Nam Prik Noom. The Kaw Soi Kai was outstanding ‚Äî the soup was rich and intense in flavor, while the chicken was incredibly tender, as if it had been slow-cooked multiple times to perfection.

The Kor Moo Yang was our favorite overall: beautifully marbled pork, grilled to perfection, with a texture and flavor that made it unforgettable. The Nam Prik Noom tasted wonderfully authentic while the Sai Aua was flavorful but a bit too spicy for us.

Service here was just as memorable as the food. The staff were warm, welcoming, and attentive. A special mention goes to Gig, our lovely waitress, who not only made excellent menu recommendations but also shared tips for local attractions.

Visited on a Tuesday, first time having Khao Soi in the US. Was impressed with the texture of the chicken. Also did a great job at serving the Sticky Rice‚Äî which came out with the perfect texture. Thank you!

Such a great kao soi but stone cold. Ordered for take out and they told me I had 2 minutes, no problem, got the food and took 2 blocks to hotel. Broth was hot but beef was fridge cold. So sad. All I wanted was hot soupy spicy noodles. And the soup seemed hot, until I bit into the tender flavor full beef and got ice cold fat. Chefs: don‚Äôt be in too much of a hurry. If your kitchen is open, it‚Äôs open. Make the first dish as good as your last. I‚Äôll be back‚Ä¶. Depending on the response

Such a hidden gem! The place is tiny but everything tastes super authentic Northern Thai. It is located between SoHo and Chinatown area. The Khao Soi is rich and comforting, the crispy pork belly stir-fry is done just right, and the red curry pork hits the spot. Drinks are refreshing (love the Lychee Soda) and nothing here is overly sweet, which I really appreciate. Sticky rice in little bamboo baskets makes it feel extra authentic. Already been back twice, def one of my favorite Thai spots here.

I came here on a Tuesday, and Namfon was absolutely wonderful! Her service was so warm and friendly. I just enjoyed chatting with her the whole time. The food was delicious, and everything was just perfect. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants.

The food was delicious and service was great!! We are visiting so asked for help with recommendations & Pooky was so kind and helped us choose everything - appetizers, main dishes, and cocktails - it ALL turned out great!!! Already planning on going back for the curry puffs - YUMMMM

Lan Larb Chiang Mai brings the local vibrant flavors of Northern Thailand straight to SoHo with impressive authenticity. Dishes are spicy, aromatic, and full of the rich, earthy flavors that defines Chiang Mai cuisine. You can taste the satisfying balance of heat, herbs, and umami. Cocktails are cleverly crafted to complement each dish. Super refreshing and well balanced. The space itself is warm and inviting accented by colorful artwork on the walls that adds unique character. The staff is genuinely friendly and always happy to explain and suggest their delicious dishes. If you‚Äôre craving for real Northern Thai food, Lan Larb Chiang Mai is absolutely worth the visit.

Delicious dishes and they have great spice levels for everyone!

We come almost every Monday night and Paris is the best always remembering what we order.

If you want some flavor, eat here now!

Visited Larb Chiang Mai this Saturday ‚Äî truly authentic Northern Thai flavors right here in NYC! üå∂Ô∏è The dishes reminded me so much of Chiang Mai. My favorite was the Khao Soi Beef ‚Äî rich, aromatic curry broth with perfectly tender beef. This place has become my go-to spot for comforting Northern Thai food ‚ù§Ô∏è

Incredible find and fantastic food! Greenie & Malee(üòçüòã) were extremely helpful in seating me and getting my food out to me right away!

A simple meal but with incredible flavor. The Duck salad is a must get!
Amazing Thai. Delicious complex flavors. The staff are very friendly. Malee was a incredibly kind waitress. Cute ambience! Would love to come back again. The seats are very comfortable too.

This would have been a five star review except for the fact that we went in late- which caused them to rush us, and the staff waited for us to finish which we get and we had to order ASAP. We got the chicken larb salad, fried calamari, and I asked them what was the spiciest thing on their menu and if they could bring that to me- the beef larb. Flavors were delicious, very authentic and a tribute to Northern Thai cuisine. They had an amazing sticky rice, it came in cute little baskets. Everything was excellent and we hope to come again with more time to enjoy our meal. We also got lychee cocktails to go with everything which were a great palate cleanser.

I had a wonderful time at this Thai restaurant. The food was authentic and flavorful, but what impressed me the most was the amazing service. The staff were polite, cheerful, and very attentive. They made sure everything was perfect throughout the meal. Highly recommend this place for both great food and excellent hospitality! The staff working on Wednesday were very friendly and professional. Their service made my visit even more enjoyable. Thank you for the great experience!

I‚Äôve been coming here for years, this is my favorite Thai restaurant. I literally have eaten or ordered from here over 100 times. I send my friends who are in town here all the time. And the long-time employee, Paris, great service every single time. I love this place. I grew up two blocks away and it‚Äôs kind of the best place around, it‚Äôs either a burger from Fanelli‚Äôs or I go to Lan Larb, and it‚Äôs, more often than not, Lan Larb.

Great service, great atmosphere, terrible food.

I love Thai food, and I think this restaurant was one of the worst in the 10 years I‚Äôve lived in NYC.

The portions felt small and the dishes are overpriced. In terms of flavor, the dishes are all overwhelmingly sweet and lack any sort of savory or spicy tastes.

Extremely disappointed by the food. Would need to be convinced strongly to ever try anything here again.

The short rib was bad and came with a measly amount of sticky rice. The tom yum soup was way too sweet. And our noodle dish was just meh.

I don‚Äôt feel like I ate at a restaurant‚Ä¶ I feel like I left a desert shop. And sure some of these dishes are meant to be sweet, but this one was way too much.

Great service, authentic Northern Thai flavour staff are all lovely,
Pookie was recommended Crispy Pork Krapao which was very tasty crispy bits coated with a yummy holy basil sauce!!! Just like we had in Thailand!!!!
If you don‚Äôt know where to start ask her !!!

If you‚Äôre craving something truly local and full of heart, this Northern Thai restaurant is a hidden gem in soho you shouldn‚Äôt miss. From the warm hospitality to the rich aromas coming from the kitchen, especially ‚ÄúSunday Team‚Äù are so sweet service and welcome detail reminds me of the charm of Chiang Mai.
Good food, but expensive. The Thai sausage was a little dry. Need more rum drinks on the menu.
Bonjour, d√Æner improvis√© dans ce restaurant pour nos 25 ans de mariage. Accueil sympathique, tr√®s bons cocktails, plats copieux et succulents. Nous recommandons.

amazing boat noodles! The lunch set is such a deal - 20 dollars for a GIGANTIC bowl of noodles and an appetizer! The noodles are definitely big enough for 2 girls to share, such a generous portion of meat.

Today I ordered crispy pork with basil and a spicy seafood soup. Both dishes were absolutely delicious! The waitress, who wore a beautiful long dress, was so lovely and friendly,I think her name was Mali(Maly,Maree,), if I remember correctly. This place will definitely go on my list of favorite restaurants.

Excellent Northern Thai food, a welcome addition to the area. I ordered one of the specialties and it was everything I wanted: intense, stinky, and flavorful. The prices are very reasonable. I appreciate that the waitress checked that I would enjoy the tour of flavors I ordered. They have many options on the menu that should suit almost anyone's preferences.

I have never been disappointed with this restaurant. I came all the way from Washington, DC, just to have lunch here. The food is excellent‚Äîtruly the best and most authentic Northern Thai cuisine. The service is great, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. I highly recommend this place, especially if you‚Äôve ever been to Chiang Mai, Thailand, because the flavors make it feel like a Chiang Mai kitchen has been brought right to the heart of Soho, New York City!

This restaurant smelled SO good upon entrance wowwww extremely fragrant knew the food was gonna hit üôèüôè loved the mango thai tea & beef pad thai! chili fried rice was too spicy for me but it had great flavor!

So yummy!! It's a smaller so gets packed fast but service was amazing. Food came very quick and my server Greenie made sure we were oki.
Will definitely come back! Thank uuu :)))

Wandered into here while on jury duty and I was satisfied with the food and service. This was a solid lunch spot.

I ordered the Moo Ping appetizer and Gang Hung Lay curry. The jim jaew could have used a bit more toasted rice and Hung Lay curry a bit more fish sauce but I am fully aware that dominant demographic served is not Thai. The host did offer me fish sauce before I even asked ‚Äî very attentive service.

The menu offered a wide array of northern dishes, which was a pleasant change from the typical offerings for the western palette.

Fantastic job to the staff working on Thursday! I was taken care of, had a nice meal, and left satisfied and satiated. Will be back!
I enjoy coming here every time I‚Äôm in the area and the food never disappoints. The staff here are friendly and inviting. Shout out to Bookie our waitress, she was amazing!

My experience at Lan Larb Chiang Mai was excellent. It was my friend's birthday yesterday and she wanted to celebrate here. I was excited because it was my first time eating Thai food. I am so glad I came here! My server Greenie was sweet, kind, and professional. She has such a bright smile and delivered perfect service. Greenie was calm, patient, and knowledgeable about the entr√©es on the menu and seafood options, which was very helpful for when we were ordering our food. She also came to check up on us while we were eating to ask about the food and if we needed anything else. The food was delicious and I enjoyed it, especially the coconut shrimps. I would definitely recommend this place to family, friends, and other people who want to try Thai food or love Thai food. Please request for server Greenie! Amazing 5-star service at this restaurant!

Malee our server was the best and so sweet and attentive. The food was authentic and delicious. Small restaurant but vibey place. We tried a lot of the menu and we loved each dish!! Def will recommend and be back :)

Really delicious Northern Thai food! My friend recommended this place and I am so glad I came, the khao soi was excellent and it came with very generous pieces of beef.

The mango sticky rice was decent but it did not wow me, I feel like the texture of the rice was a little too hard for my liking.

The staff are attentive but a little too fast, granted the restaurant was loud but I wasn‚Äôt finished with my food yet and they took it away already üòÖüòÖ
So tasty and flavorful! It‚Äôs been an uber eats regular for us for quite some time but visiting the restaurant was even better with Laura and the team taking good care of us

My friends and I visited this Thai restaurant right before Halloween, and perhaps it was because we were starving after a long day of walking, but the food was surprisingly delicious! We cleaned our plates ‚Äì not a single drop left. The bathroom even had spiderwebs on the mirror for a fun Halloween touch, which was a nice detail.

Came here on a whim because we were craving Asian with some kicks and we‚Äôre close by.  The space is small but the menu is super extensive and comprehensive. We opted for something simple (because we were just starving) but I would urge you to be more adventurous.

App:
Fried calamari with ginger avocado sauce
Simple, but pretty different with the ginger avocado sauce. It is smooth with a spicy kick, added to the hot and crispy fried calamari.

Entree:
Kanom Jean Nham Ngiaw
Fermented rice noodle topped with pig cracklings/pork rinds, bean sprout, and cabbage. Honestly it tasted exactly as it said on the menu. Sweet, sour, salty, though sweet is ‚Äúturned up to 11‚Äù. The thin rice noodles they use have this intrinsic texture that to me lacks toothfulness so I am not a fan. And I don‚Äôt like the texture of the rinds after they soak up the liquid and because sweet and mushy. This is what my friend had and she didn‚Äôt finish. It isn‚Äôt a bad dish, it is just so that great for us on that day.

Crab meat fried rice
With lumped crab meat, egg, and scallion. This is actually the favorite of us two. Somehow they managed to have a fantastic ‚Äúwok hei‚Äù combined with a umami yet still citrusy taste to their flavor. It is quite addictive to have a spoonful of sweet crab + umami egg + chewy-bouncy rice + herby scallion.

I am intrigued by this restaurant and I feel I want to explore more of their menu options next times I come around. If they can do the simple dishes justice, then I hope they excel on other complex ones too.

Amazing food, spicy and incredibly flavorful‚Äî it reminds me of my travels to Chiang Mai.  The team working there on Friday were so accommodating and helpful.  My friend had an allergy that needed accommodating and they were so diligent about advising on items from the menu.  When we were waiting for our table, the hostess also walked all the way outside to bring us in.  A kind of hospitable gesture that I almost never experience in the city!  Great vibes all around.
Went to this restaurant on this Tuesday! Food was so delicious and services are amazing! Will definitely come back!

This spot is stellar! Rolled in at 9:35 not knowing the place closed at 10, but they kindly seated us to order during last call. We tried the papaya salad and panang curry‚Ä¶incredible. The Thursday night crew took great care of us and exceeded our expectations. Will definitely come back!
Recommended Authentic Thai Foodüáπüá≠ and staff so friendly (warm welcome) treated  us like a family. Thank you so much ka üíó feel like I'm home  #Thurs team

Northern style Thai food, not your typical Thai. Every dish is amazing and has a unique taste. It's always good to try something different because all their dishes are worth trying. Drinks are great, too. Small but very welcoming restaurant. Best food for the money in this area. Highly recommended.

I usually only rate restaurants based on the quality and deliciousness of the food. I really don't care about service or atmosphere. That said, EVERYTHING was great about our lunch at Lan Larb Chiang.  Everything. And everyone that works there.  Especially Malee who couldn't be more helpful and patient in assisting us in planning our dishes - taking care of everyone's food sensitivities, being real with us about spice levels - she was spot on in figuring out what we'd love. Whatever you choose to eat - you seemly can't go wrong. Everything was great. Also whatever nostalgia playlist they had on during our lunch was so fun (and not too loud.) We had a great time and can't wait to go back.

Ordered spring rolls that turned out to be egg rolls but they were tasty. Unfortunately, the spring roll sauce, the tom yum, and the massaman curry were all extremely sweet. The tom yum was barely sour, but it did have a lot of meat in it which was somewhat redeeming. Service was good and they had fun Halloween decor up.
Thursday team is awesome. Great food. Good service. I like the pineapple fried rice.

My friend and I ate here last saturday, and it‚Äôs safe to say it will be one of my favorite thai restaurants to come back to when I visit NY. It was my first time here, I ordered whatever I recognized in hopes that it would taste somewhat similar to my moms cooking. Needless to say, it surpassed my expectations. For one, I ordered the Curry Pastry, I am usually disappointed by these when ordering in other restaurants or even in Thailand, but these ones were even filled with Mozzarella and tasted so so good! The second thing I ordered was Tom Kha Gai, so creamy with so much flavour. Also, the Thai Iced Tea had me very satisfied.
The staff were very nice, and even speak thai. The restaurant itself has a cool casual speak-easy vibe to it. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting authentic Thai Food in the middle of SoHo!
Thank you Team Lan Larb for this tasteful experience, hope to see you again soon!
Bursting with authentic Northern Thai flavors Lan Larb Chiang Mai is a Soho gem that balances heat, herbs, and heart. Thank you @Sunday Team üòâ
